clinical_study.brief_title: Telephone Reminder to Increase Appointment Rates
clinical_study.official_title: Reducing the Rate of Missed Appointments in an Outpatient Substance Use Treatment Clinic in Norway

brief_summary.textblock:
Missed appointments to outpatient substance use treatment are common and costly and can have a negative effect on the health of patients.
In this quasi-experimental study, the investigators used an on-off design to examine whether a reminder "plus" intervention (telephone call from therapist before first appointment) would increase attendance and improve cancellation and rebooking practices. Secondary outcomes included satisfaction with treatment and intention to complete the treatment program.

study_design_info.masking_description: The aim of the study was presented to all participants (to examine dropout/ retention from treatment), but patients were blinded to information about the phase comparison (i.e., that there was a pretreatment telephone Call from therapist in one phase and not in the other).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 10 treatment sessions, estimated average timeframe = 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Attendance rate at first admission and during 10 outpatient sessions

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 10 treatment sessions, estimated average timeframe = 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Dropout rate within 10 sessions - measured as formal discharge and/or "technical discharge" (3x no-shows)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 10 treatment sessions, estimated average timeframe = 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Examine difference in cancellation / rebooking rate between the two conditions. Data was collected from administrative patient records.

other_outcome.description: Treatment satisfaction - measured with the Session Rating Scale (scale 0 - 40, higher scores means higher satisfaction)
Intention to complete treatment program. Self-developed measured based on the Theory of Planned Behavior. Scale 1 - 7, higher scores means higher intention to Complete treatment).

arm_group.description: No reminder plus (telephone reminder from therapist) but standard test message reminder (SMS) from second admission
Reminder plus (telephone reminder from therapist) AND standard test message reminder (SMS) from second admission

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Newly referred patient
- > 18 years
- Diagnosis: Substance related disorder
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are unable to understand or score the survey due to cognitive or language barriers
